hero_subtitle: Your mind is unique, and your learning tools should be too. We're building Chiara to adapt to your way of thinking, not the other way around. Because great ideas can come from anyone, anywhere.
framework_subtitle: Simple steps that follow your natural way of learning
step1_desc: Upload your notes, lectures, and study materials — we'll organize them in a way that works for you.
step2_desc: Transform information into personalized knowledge that fits your way of thinking.
step3_desc: Practice and reinforce concepts with interactive exercises that evolve as you progress.
step4_desc: Build confidence by articulating concepts in your own words for deeper understanding.
features_subtitle: Designed around how people actually learn, not how they're expected to
feature1_desc: Say goodbye to rigid learning methods. Chiara adapts to your unique style, making even complex topics feel natural and approachable.
feature2_desc: From lecture notes to study guides, all our tools work seamlessly together. Enjoy a complete learning journey with no gaps in understanding.
feature3_desc: Whether you're studying quantum physics or art history, our platform adapts to your subject's needs while keeping a consistent approach.
feature4_desc: Let Chiara handle the heavy lifting—organizing materials, creating study guides, and generating practice questions—so you can focus on learning.
feature5_desc: Stuck on a concept at 2 AM or need a quick revision before an exam? Chiara is always there to help you understand, practice, and master your material.
feature6_title: Track Your Progress with Smart Insights
feature6_desc: Track your progress with detailed insights and analytics. Celebrate small wins and pinpoint areas for improvement with our intelligent tracking system.
universities_subtitle: Trusted by students at top universities worldwide
product_demo_subtitle: Experience what using Chiara will look like.
organizationDemo.title: Organization
organizationDemo.subtitle: Organize Smarter
organizationDemo.description: Combine your notes and mind maps to build a comprehensive understanding of your subjects. Uncover hidden patterns and connections that conventional methods often miss. Enhance your learning with detailed annotations and visual summaries that reinforce key concepts and stimulate critical thinking.
comprehensionDemo.title: Comprehension
comprehensionDemo.subtitle: Understand Deeply
comprehensionDemo.description: Combine your notes and mind maps to build a comprehensive understanding of your subjects. Uncover hidden patterns and connections that conventional methods often miss. Enhance your learning with detailed annotations and visual summaries that reinforce key concepts and stimulate critical thinking.
memorizationDemo.title: Memorization
memorizationDemo.subtitle: Retain Effectively
memorizationDemo.description: Reinforce your knowledge with interactive exercises tailored to your progress. Our smart flashcards promote active memorization and long-term retention—try them out now!
memorizationDemo.watchHint: Watch the flashcard reveal the answer.
memorizationDemo.flashcard1.question: What is the **capital** of **France**?
memorizationDemo.flashcard2.question: What is the **largest** mammal?
memorizationDemo.flashcard3.question: What is the **fastest** land animal?
cta_subtitle: A more intuitive way to study

interactiveAITutorDemo.mainSubtitle: Instantly get answers and insights from your uploaded materials. Ask questions and let Chiara guide you through your study content.
interactiveAITutorDemo.docParagraph1: Photosynthesis is a vital biological process that converts light energy into chemical energy, primarily occurring in plants, algae, and some bacteria. This process uses sunlight, water, and carbon dioxide to create glucose, which serves as an energy source for the organism, and oxygen, which is released into the atmosphere.
interactiveAITutorDemo.docParagraph2: The overall chemical equation for photosynthesis is: 6CO2 + 6H2O + Light Energy → C6H12O6 + 6O2. This reaction typically takes place in chloroplasts, specialized organelles within plant cells, specifically within the thylakoid membranes (light-dependent reactions) and the stroma (light-independent reactions or Calvin cycle).
interactiveAITutorDemo.docParagraph3: Several factors can affect the rate of photosynthesis, including light intensity, carbon dioxide concentration, temperature, and water availability. Understanding these factors is crucial for comprehending plant growth and ecosystem productivity.
interactiveAITutorDemo.userQuestion1: What triggered the start of World War I?
interactiveAITutorDemo.aiAnswer1: According to your materials, the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand in 1914 triggered the start of World War I.
interactiveAITutorDemo.userQuestion2Gene: What is the powerhouse of the cell?
interactiveAITutorDemo.aiAnswer2General: The mitochondrion is often referred to as the powerhouse of the cell. It generates most of the cell's supply of adenosine triphosphate (ATP), used as a source of chemical energy.
interactiveAITutorDemo.explanationP1: Ask questions about your uploaded documents and get instant, powerful explanations. Verify information with direct source citations.
studyAidGeneratorDemo.explanationP1: Automatically generate organized lecture notes, flashcards, mind maps, and quizzes from your uploaded documents and audio files. Streamline your study process and focus on what matters most.
enhancedDemo.mainSubtitle: Listen to content, get summaries and explanations for selected text, all in one place.
enhancedDemo.panelPrompt: Select text in the document to generate study materials.
enhancedDemo.paragraph1: The process of photosynthesis, vital for most life on Earth, converts light energy into chemical energy, stored in glucose. This complex biochemical pathway occurs in chloroplasts, primarily within the leaves of plants. It involves two main stages: the light-dependent reactions and the light-independent reactions (Calvin cycle).
enhancedDemo.paragraph2: The Calvin cycle, occurring in the stroma of the chloroplasts, utilizes the ATP and NADPH produced during the light-dependent reactions to fix atmospheric carbon dioxide into organic sugar molecules.
enhancedDemo.paragraph3: Factors influencing the rate of photosynthesis include light intensity, carbon dioxide concentration, temperature, and water availability. Understanding these factors is critical for optimizing plant growth in agricultural and ecological contexts. For instance, a deficiency in any of these can significantly limit the photosynthetic output, thereby affecting the entire food web.
enhancedDemo.mockExplanation: NADPH (nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide phosphate) is a coenzyme produced during the light-dependent reactions of photosynthesis that carries high-energy electrons and protons to the Calvin cycle, providing the reducing power needed to fix carbon dioxide into sugars.
enhancedDemo.summaryDescription: Condense selected text into key points
enhancedDemo.explanationDescription: Provide detailed explanation of selected text
